issue.title: mail.google.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/#inbox](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmail.google.com%2Fmail%2Fu%2F0%2F%23inbox) ### Comment > I am not able to download attachments from GMail. The same goes for Google Drive, I click the download button it does request some domains but it doesn't start the download. This issue is kinda weird because when I turn off and restart firefox, now I can download files from GMail and GDrive. But just turning the protection on/off still won't let me download files from GMail/GDrive. Maybe you can find a way to fix this because when I reported this to Google, they didn't like the idea of me mentioning Adguard, they tried to blaim it on Adguard directly which I think is unfair. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
@zloyden How about the placeholder on mobile? `in-content-ad-wrapper` The page seems to have a different result regarding to AG product. With AdGuard for Windows (Firefox/Chromium) = everything is fine With AdGuard Extension + Chromium = Cookie Pop-up returned due unblock `cdn.opencmp.net`
Screenshot: ![promi6](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6276915/205602177-459eada9-1043-4837-93b7-24ea579f38ec.png)

With AdGuard Extension + Firefox = Cookie Pop-up returned and it also has the Article placeholder
Screenshot: ![promi5](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6276915/205602308-32a91d09-bd34-46cf-8ec2-a8e349f9d846.png)

AdGuard for iOS and AdGuard for Android = Cookie Pop-up and also Article Ad placeholder

comment.body:
I tried this rule which removes it, scrolling works and the video plays too, please check @Morku 

`promipool.de#%#AG_onLoad(function(){setTimeout(function(){if(!document.cookie.includes("trf-euconsent-v2")){var g=new MutationObserver(function(){var b=document.querySelector('body > #page ~ div:not([class]):not([id])');b&&(g.disconnect(),b.remove())});g.observe(document,{childList:!0,subtree:!0});setTimeout(function(){g.disconnect()},1E4)}},500);});`

comment.body:
I guess that if button is clicked too fast (before cookie notice is visible) then for some reasons cookie notice is not hidden later.
Clicking on button when cookie notice is visible seems to works fine:
```adblock
mydealz.de#%#AG_onLoad(function(){if(!document.cookie.includes("cookie_policy_agreement")){var a=new MutationObserver(function(){var c=document.querySelector(".popover--visible button + button[data-t=\"continueWithoutAcceptingBtn\"]");c&&(a.disconnect(),c.click())});a.observe(document,{childList:!0,subtree:!0}),setTimeout(function(){a.disconnect()},1E4)}});
```

Let's do next.
1. Leave only `AdGuard French`
2. Put AdGuard on the pause mode and open the page
3. Do right click on the necessary element and select `inspect code`
4. You'll see the code of the element
5. Take a screenshot with the code
6. Turn on the protection, open the filtering log
7. Reload the page
8. Switch back to the filtering log and take a screenshot
9. Send those screenshots here.

comment.body:
Regarding the report title, it seems the AdGuard team has been very slow with implementing the "Dangerous site" button from the GitHub report form, on their AdGuard website report form: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22780683/205665081-9aeef04a-08c1-43cf-83c2-d6725d1f8a91.png)

I've got good contacts in the adblocking community, and would be able to speed up that process, provided I can figure out where the AdGuard team intends for webform changes to be suggested.

comment.body:
> It still baffles me why or even how that reporter keeps showing up as "ghost", as I'm beginning to wonder whether the reporter has even the faintest knowledge how GitHub works like.
> 
> Furthermore, they should probably use codewrapping of their very danger-potent links as well.

I just don’t really need a permanent GitHub account. I want to stay anonymous (many reasons). I would like to report it though official tool, but it has no «scam» report title. So I need to do something like this.

issue.title: www.aura.ge
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.aura.ge/103-saskolo/11189-davit-guramishvili--davitiani-poema-tavebis-mixedvit.html](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.aura.ge%2F103-saskolo%2F11189-davit-guramishvili--davitiani-poema-tavebis-mixedvit.html) ### Comment Username: @DandelionSprout > What appears to be various ads. I propose `aura.ge##[href="https://talizi.ge/ka/"]` and `aura.ge##[href="https://trinx.ge/"]`. This report is the perplexing and confounded result of uBlock Filters **and** EasyList refusing to include entries for small-language sites as per https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uAssets/issues/15896, and uBO's years-long refusal to enable AdGuard Base Filter by default despite the latter's strong regional coverage. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/T6MhJ6X.png)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- Platform: | uBlock Origin Browser: | Chrome Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base Custom filters: | uBO defaults
